subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: Maps in the Age of Disinformation
description: A fast breakdown of Maps in the Age of Disinformation for builders.

hook.text: North Korea shows itself three times larger on its own maps than it actually is.

buildup.text: Countries routinely distort maps to claim disputed territory. China, India, and Pakistan all do this.

discovery.text: Google Maps shows different borders depending on which country you're viewing from.

twist.text: Russia banned accurate maps of its cities during the Cold War. Only distorted versions were published.

climax.text: Today, AI-generated fake satellite images can make troops or buildings appear where none exist.

punchline.text: Maps can lie, and now AI helps them lie better.

quiz.question: How does Google Maps handle disputed borders?
options: It shows different borders depending on the user's country
